column11: Review Text
Old parliament building from the British colonial period. Easy to access but lots of security. Nice place to walk about and take photos.
Very iconic building within the town centre of Colombo, Sri Lanka. Great for a picture and speak to the staff, overall would recommend a picture.

column8: Old Parliament building is now the Presidential Secretariat
column11: This old Parliament building is now the Presidential Secretariat since 1983. It's a neo Baroque style building constructed during the British colonial era and opened in 1930.  It is in the city area and can accessed from the street. Heavy security presence. You can walk around the building area to have an idea of the scale of the complex. Need comfy walking shoes, hat, water and sunscreen

column8: Looks like our government building in Washington, DC
column11: While in the Old Fort Area, my Tuktuk Driver pointed out this building to me. He said that this was where the members of the parliament meet or the equivalent of Congress in Washington, DC. Noted some statues of prominent perons in front of this building.  Was told not open to tourists.
Amazing!  Great history and excellent learning for teens on Parliament, Government and referendums.  The highlight was the Prime Minister Hawkes offices, felt like I was viewing a day in the life.
This is in the Colombo Fort area facing the sea and close to the president's  House. It is built in ne-baroque style and opened on January 29 1930.

Walking on my own in Colombo, I saw the Old Parliament Building. It is a huge building with a numerous statues showing the history of Sri Lanka's politics. I appreciated the old architecture. Very nice.
This is a lovely building that was situated next to our hotel. But you could not go inside the gates and are not permitted to take photos. Luckily I took some nice pictures from our hotel window.

column8: Presidential staff office with photo ban
column11: Nice to look at as you stroll by but we were accosted by armed police when we took a photo. No need to single it out, you will simply see it facing the beach as you head north to Fort or south to Galle Rd shops.
A very beautiful building with a number of statues showing the history of local politics as we walked past and admired it.

The Iconic Place for Corruption and Bad Management. The Country ruled by the last 7 decades have been mismanaged using this building. Everyone who promise for development only limit the development to their families without caring the public. One of the Worse place in the country except for Political Slaves. Even a coup was staged using staff who were employed this cursed building.

The Parliament is moved to another Place. In front of Old Building there will be built very modern new part of Colombo. The project new Dubai in Sri Lanka, will be built by CCCC from China and financed, by the capital from China, Japan and Gulf Emirates.
This is another great looking colonial era building built by Dutch. Earlier was used for parliament purpose
This old beautiful buildling used to host Sri Lankan parliament. Located near colombo fort amazing piece of art.

During a tour of the city we saw and visited many interesting sites/sights. This is a grand building built in the british Colonial era, in the early 1900‚Äôs, becoming Parliament of Sri Lanka in 1977 until 1983, now home to the Presidential Secretariat. Definetly worth a look for historical value alone.
I was happy to see that parliament building was so easily available for viewing from outside unlike other places. It was an kind of good experience.
Impressive old colonial parliament building. Great architecture in classic, traditional sense. It was not open to visitors, however you can take in the great views from the fence line.
In a city with many lovely buildings, this is one of the best. It is a classic stucture unlike many of the others in this area.
This was  for some time the building which housed the national parliament of Sri Lanka until it moved to a new site.  The lovely building now is the home of the presidential secretariat.

If you love British architecture, I suggest you take a walk around the Fort area and also take a look at the old British government buildings. They are classic and beautifully constructed. Take a walk on Galle Face Green and imagine the British having horse races on the green just for their entertainment. It is a very Colonial experience.

The Neo-Baroque-style building was built during the British colonial era to house the Legislative Council of Ceylon, and was an idea of Sir Henry McCallum. The building was opened on 29 January 1930. In 1972, the National State Assembly convened in the building until 1977, when it was renamed the Parliament of Sri Lanka. Parliament then moved out to new complex and the building then became home to the Presidential Secretariat. It faces the sea in Colombo fort area and it is built in Neo-Boroque style
This is where the Parliament meetings were held in old days. The British had built it. There is nothing to see in it. It is being used by the President of Sri Lanka.
Beautifully lit up at Xmas time, but also very well guarded. There is some lovely architecture here.

The Old Parliament Building, is the building that houses the Presidential Secretariat of Sri Lanka. Situated in the Colombo fort area facing the sea, it is in close proximity to the President's House, Colombo and adjacent to the General Treasury Building. The building housed the island's legislature for 53 years until the new parliamentary complex was opened at Sri Jayawardenepura in 1983.
Located in the Fort Area of Colombo, opposite galle beach.   It 's a great piece of architecture which makes you wonder how it was built back in those days.  A true gem in Colombo.

This old parliament building was made in british time. Actually it's architecture is so much related to white house in Washington DC. This place is located just infront of galle face ground. If you visit galle face beach this is just walking distance. So this is one of the must visit place in colombo city. You can capture selfies there. Now there are not parliament meetings now. Parliament meetings shifted to new parliament building. But sometimes there are meetings. So this is one of high protected area in colombo. You cant park your vehicle infront of this building. So you can park your vehicle at galle face parking and you can go there.

I spent over 2 hours touring this house and thoroughly enjoyed it.   It's a bit like being on an old movie set.   The history it brings back is remarkable.   I especially liked the prime minister office and quarters. Well worth the time and visit.

Although a left over from the colonial past, it is different from all the buildings of that era. It has a strange resemblance to the White House of Washington DC although smaller and of a brownish colour. The building with a very interesting past is a minor attraction in the Galle Face area.
One of the important buildings of Sri Lanka. No entry inside but one can take photos from outside. Very near to  Galle Face Green.
Beautiful old colonial building, worth visiting. Just outside of the hustle and bustle of the city center.

The Old Parliament Building, as the name suggests, is the old parliament building of Sri Lanka. It is located in the Fort Area of Colombo, near the Galle Face Green. I visited the place just for beautiful pictures of the building, but was amazed at how beautiful it looks despite being over 60 years old. The architectural style is imperial, and so regal. Highly recommended to visit (you probably will, if you are in Colombo).
The huge columned facade of this huge building is very impressive. Set amongst the huge port development this imposing building is worth a visit, if only to photograph the exterior.

This was a most impressive building, very well maintained, & majestic among all the construction going on in the area.  I tried to read the plaques on the plinths of the statues but the railings make that really difficult, shame
This building is nicely maintained by local government. Located right next to galle face green , however people are not allowed to go inside.
That's where the history of modern sri Lanka started. Located at green galle face,  this is beautiful and most visit place.

This is in the middle of town with most of the star class hotels and key Govt buildings surrounding it  if you want to tour this area on foot choose early evening start from the Kings berry hotel to  the Hilton Cross The road and move down on the side of the temple,the Finance ministry is next,pass the Old Parliament to the left and the Baray lake basin is what you see in front, when you look at the sea this is a massive development project  called the Colombo Port City Development project. will leave the rest to you, if you want to have something to drink one of the coffeeshops is the hotels are ok , but go round the Hilton towards the World trade center you will find this delightful place called the dutch Hospital try any restaurant for a different experience like form the exclusive restaurants like The Ministry Of Crab, must reserve,dress code and all, posh posh place.or just whatever floats your boat  safe place to walk a round and not too far from the star class hotels,if that's where you spend the night.

Old Parliament House is a well-preserved part of Australian history. The displays were well presented and interesting. It was my favourite sightseeing day in Canberra. Well worth the time for a visit. Easy to walk to there from new Parliament House.
Even though it's in front of the Galle Face trance, no one is allowed to enter or visit the premisses. Also No direct photographs allowed, since it's a high security zone.
Nicely kept, by the side of the main road, near the beach.. Saw from outside only. Not a very charming look, but worth a visit
Old parliament building was in very near i stay it‚Äôs was great experience to visit Very beautiful Location
Nice surrounding..just infront of gall face and new port city extention. Bera Lake divide Shangria Hotel.. cant do much they allow photography now..
This building is quite prominent from the main road, not far from the lighthouse. It is of its time; colonial power-achitecture!
Near the seafront is the old parliament building which is dwarfed by two modern skyscrapers.  It opened in 1930 when there were no other structures in the vicinity.
Include as part of a walking trip around Colombo. We walked around the park and looked at the statues.

You will find the Old Parliament building in the Colombo fort area, opposite the Galle Face Green and the Indian Ocean. It was built during the British Colonial era to be the seat of the Legislative Council of Ceylon and is of neo-baroque style. It remained the heart of legislation until the new Parliament building was opened in 1983. Now it houses the Presidential Secretariat. In front of the building is a garden containing statues of various key statesmen of the island. This is a very interesting part of Sri Lanka's history and heritage and well worth taking a look at. it is within easy walking distance of the Fort and Galle Face Green area hotels.
It's a great place surrounded by greenery and the war memorial. The statue of the Father of the nation is worth looking at.
It's crawling with soldiers and you can't go in but it's right by the Galle road and picks up the sunset very nicely.
The old parliament building is a huge structure resembling many such buildings in Europe. Nicely situated adjacent to a lake on one side and facing sea on the other.

Old Parliament is a prominent land mark in the city of Colombo. It is facing the famous Galle Face Green. Walking distance from most of the 5 star and the other hotels in the main city. Public is not allowed to enter with out proper permission.
The view of the parliament building and surrounding area is very beautiful. the place is so calm and nice.
I passed through this place while walking across the beach road in the evening, Even in the dark the building was prominent and showed that it was a magnificent structure.

The old Parliament building which is near the Fort is a splendid building from the colonial era. The PM's office used to be at the back of the Parliament. There are statues of former Prime Minister's in the grounds.

The Old Parliament Building was built during the British colonial era to house the Legislative Council of Ceylon. Now the building houses the Presidential Secretariat of Sri Lanka. It‚Äôs situated very near to the Colombo fort facing the sea and is in close proximity to the President's House, Colombo. The front garden of the Old Parliament Building is host to several bronze statues of eminent statesmen, which are really nice. The architectural footprints of the British Colonial era is very easy to spot and remember. It's a nice place to visit in Colombo.

Located right next to the Fort area makes it really convenient to get here. One can simply walk from the fort area or also from the galle face beach. The parliament building stands proud among some other higg rise building but its lush green lawn stands out in the crowd as nothing like it is nearby. The architectural footprints of the British Colonial era is pretty easy to mark. Absolutely recommended if in Colombo.
An iconic historical structure facing the sea in Galle Face area. Upcoming skyscrapers trying to overshadow this superb architectural marvel radiating history.
This building is located within Colombo Commercial District and next to the coastal line of Colombo. Surely an Historical Place.

Iconic & amazing is my choice of words. A complete reminder of the Colonial past of Sri Lanka. Since it is been used as part of the Presidential Secretariat looks a very busy place. I love the statues that keep looking at the travelers.

I lived at Cinnamon grand for 2 weeks and hence I passed through this building 10 times. I walked to this place during weekend to see how good does it look. Its very good stylish colonial building but its managed poorly. The statue is not clean as there are too many birds. There is a beautiful lake behind this building but the lake is not yet developed. I am not sure about how do you go inside the building, but if you have time, just go there to see this beautiful building. There are some real big buildings coming up nearby. Please make sure you keep this building beauty intact.
Came here every morning before and after jogging. A nice piece of history in this fast modernizing place in the city.
Unlike the current Sri Lankan parliament, which is separated from public spaces by big moats, the older one is situated within public spaces. Therefore stands as a symbol of traditional democracy...
A nice place to take a photo...kind of Lanka heritage...i can see that got some army protect the place around this building.

Constructed during British Era, the whole place have a British vibe surrounding it...opposite Galle face..no place to stop vehice...Cant enter inside...so , apt for a short photo op, ticking the box of buildings seen...and bid goodbye!!
There isn't anything spectacular about this building, unless architecture is for you, in which case you will appreciate the colonial architecture.

its a cultural part of the city. a monument with its values.feels good to relate with their cultural and political history. good park to stroll if its not too hot or rainy total picutre perfect place.

This is one of the landmarks of Colombo. Impressive architecturally, the building is located in a very ideal location overlooking the Indian ocean. It's a must visit spot each time you are in Colombo. You can see heaps of people strolling along this building in the evening.
Situated at Galle Face near World Trade Centre. Start your stroll of Galle Face beach from here and walk the entire lenght of the beach side during the evenings
A magnificent building overlooking the mighty Indian Ocean. Photography prohibited, however you can get across the road and click a few
This is an Impressive building and there are a number of similar buildings behind it, which are easily seen by just walking along the street.

Though, there is a new parliament established in Sri Lanka at the Capital city of Sri Jeyawardanapura, this building remain as a remarkable one not only for Sri Lankans but also for those who like to study on Colonial era in Sri Lanka. This building is functioning as a Ministerial office, President's secretariat and other key high officials meeting point. Good to visit this place in case if you visit to Galle face, world trade center as they all located nearby.
Beautiful old style British empire looking building, worth a stop and drive around as it is a splendid site and harks back to bygone era's

The old Parliament Building is a remarkable Colonial architecture having a political history and stands in front of the sea. It is located in the heart of of Colombo Fort, this architectural marvel is a unique building in Sri Lanka.It is now the office of the President. Therefore, there is high security employed and declared as high security area. The sea is just after the Gall road that runs in front of it. Therefore no parking or stoppage of vehicles are allowed and you have to reach there by walking. The garden / front area land is covered by high iron fence and you are not allowed inside but only see and appreciate the building from little far. People allowed in are only on appointment or to attend a function by invitation. It is a beauty of Colombo. And the old colonial building with European architecture is ionic. The parliament was shifted to Sri Jayawardenapura after new building was constructed. Some State  functions takes place here such as Sworn of the Presidents, Foreign head of state Politician‚Äôs visits, Presidents address /meetings with concerned parties etc. You may take photos from outside the fenced area near the Galle road. Old Parliament Building shows the Old charm which was a symbol of the past where the venue for the preservation of  the rights of the people, respect the legacy, history took place in the past. The hotels;  Galadari, Hilton, Kingsbury, Shangrila, ITC, Taj Samudra and  Galleface Hotel are in close proximity. Nearby  the Treasury, Ministry of Finance, Departments of National Planning, External Resources are located. The world trade center Colombo is close by.
Can't enter, take pics from outside. Lanka needs to become tourist friendly, need to throw up a number of buildings for public.
This is our old parliment, which is now used as the Presidential Secretariet. Due to security reason there are limitations however a good place to visit.
A good piece of architecture to have a look at, reminiscent of the colonial era. Good to have a quick look and take a couple of photos.
Historic Building overlooking the ocean at Galle Face Park. But strange that all the statues of preeminent Sri Lankans are wearing western suits.
We get to see lot of british era buildings and this old Parliment building is a big structure well maintained retaining the originality of the building
Impressive old colonial parliament building.  Cool architecture in classic, traditional sense. Not open for  visitors, but you can get next views from outside the fence.
An impressive building but you can't get into it. I wouldn't go out of my way to see it but interestin to pass on a walking tour of the fort.

The Old parliament Building is a building that houses the presidential secretariat of Sri Lanka. It is situated in the city of Colombo on the sea coast well close to the Green face Galle area. I did view this from the outside on my city tour.

Old parliament of Sri Lanka was at a walking distance from our Hotel Galadari. This was our first destination of city tour. However at the time of our visit, President of Sri Lanka was coming here by Helicopter so Police did not allow to park our vehicle here. The old parliament is just at main road side. It is a monument. Can visit.
it stands lost & forlorn, right in the busy heart of Fort. albeit stately,  abandoned; like all "state"ly things of yesteryear.  grass is green around it, holding out hope of good things to come
An old colonial building on the Fort area, best photographed from outside. It is quite uninteresting despite its historical value.

A place must visit by everyone visits Sri Lanka, Colombo. Tourists and other do keep in mind that you are not allowed to go in or climb the fence to take pictures. If you need parking üÖø it is not allowed. Therefore walk and come.
An old building with a suitable facade near the front worth a stroll past to take a photo or two. Then onwards to Galle Face Green.

Beautiful old building but difficult to photograph through the railings so I stood up on the half metre wall to obtain a clear view over the top. Mayhem ensued as a guard came rushing towards me from 60 m away. I waited held out my hand and smiled as he helped me down. All Ok but apparently not allowed to stand on wall and in particular photograph the building with the Prime Minister inside - hence the panic but how was I to know? Suggest check with the gate guards beforehand.
Visited the old parliament building. It was good to stand in the building where importance decisions were made.
The old parliament building is located enroute on Galle road with beautiful Architecture, we could see from outside only. Nice place to see
It is a shame that no way to go inside for a tour. It is currently serves as the Presidential secretariat. It is prohibited to takes photos close by.

The Old Parliament Building is superbly located enroute on Galle Road towards Colombo Fort and is facing the Indian Ocean. I walked past this morning which afforded some excellent photo opportunities. I would very much like to visit the interior on my next visit to Sri Lanka.
The Old Parliament building is on the main promenade in Colombo, which is very well connected. It has a variety of decent places to stay, with many more new hotels coming up.
Good to take pictures and observe from the outside. I'm wondering if they have a tour inside this building, it could be one of the tourist attraction. We walked here on our way to the beach.
Located far from Galle, the place is really beautiful and must visit, we even saw the new parliament house which was ok!

Very nice old building with European architecture. Old parliament area. Not allowed to enter for public, unless attending for an official matter. State of there such as presidents sworn in, takes place in this building.
Good to see from outside. Can not go inside. It over looks the beach and has all the main buildings next to it.

The Old Parliament Building is a Neo-Baroque-style building close to Galle Face Green that was built during the British colonial era to house the Legislative Council of Ceylon in 1930. In 1972, when Sri Lanka achieved the independence. it housed the Parliament of Sri Lanka till it moved to the new complex in Sri Jayawardenapura Kotte in 1983, when it became the home to the Presidential Secretariat (the office of the President of Sri Lanka). There are several bronze statues in the front garden dedicated to eminent statestmen. it is a pity that you can only admire it from the gate.

Having driven through the suburbs of Colombo the area around the Old Parliamnet building was impressive with its open lawns and impresive architecture.Our hotel was adjacent to the area and it was an interesting part of Colombo and unexpected. There are a number of interesting buildings and areas close to the Old Parliament Building and the best way was to walk the streets which seemed quite safe.

The old parliament building is an imposing building that you won't miss if you are travelling past the Galle Face Green in Colombo. Despite the many high-rises dotting the area, this building still manages to hold its own. It is a building with lots of historical significance as It has functioned as the Presidential Secretariat and the Office of the Executive President since 1983. This is where all important official announcements are made and appointments of the State are administered. Note - You cannot enter the building premises ... only take photos from outside the railings.
Located at one end of galle face and near all major hotels...worth a visit...also there are few good cafes aroind for an evening out with family
An impressive piece of architecture, but as all you can do is view it through iron railings it would not be at the top of my list of things to do.
Can be seen from outside only as no  stoppage allowed. Beautiful building with scenic view. Dutch and Portugese impression
Beautiful setting overlooking the beachfront & major intersection. Great example of Colonial architecture & a beautiful graceful building.
Not really much to do tbh all you can do is take a picture. Probably done in 5 mins so don't set your hopes high!

The former Parliament is still a good example of Graeco Roman architecture for the aficionado. Not open to the public , a high security zone but those of us who were lucky to visit  have seen that the interior is well maintained with lovely woodwork. It has the statues of  national heroes on the front lawn, Always worth watching especially for birdwatchers is the adjacent Beira lake which attracts  a number of fishing birds most mornings   - mainly the pelicans find it  quite a buffet on some days.

It's a beautiful colonial building built by the British & declared open on 29th January 1930, located on Lotus Road, Colombo Fort, in close proximity of the Galadari, Hilton, Kingsbury, Shangrila, ITC, Taj Samudra & Galleface Hotels. Behind it the Treasury, Ministry of Finance, Departments of National Planning, External Resources are located. The world trade center, Colombo, Bank of Ceylon, The Central Bank, Naval HQ, former Dutch Hospital, Colombo Port, Ministry of Defence & Queen's House the Presidential Palace are located in the surrounding areas. The building boats of majestic neo-baroque style architecture was declared open by the British Governor Sir Herbert Stanley. It housed the Ceylon State Council in 1931. It was declared as the Parliament of Sri Lanka in 1977 and functioned as the Parliament until 1983. Currently it houses the Presidential Secretariat  at which many distinguished state guests  and business delegations are hosted. Both the internal as well as external architecture is uniquely well designed.
Very beautiful, European style building. General public not allowed to enter though. We were told, the building is still used for certain state functions.
the building is must visit in the city, build in European architecture, you can the understand the history of the rule of European on the region . do visit early to avoid the heat and sun
this is our president's office as a one of his director i am working here at this historic place  this is a good  place and very old place in Sri Lanka
It's another opportunity to take a quick photo. The building is attractive but there is not much else to see here.
Nice building with European architecture. Not allowed to enter for public, unless attending for an official matter. State functions such as presidents sworn in, takes place in this building.
The heritage structure gives a different look as it is surrounded by all skyscrapers and modern buildings

column7: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
column11: Very lovely building. Heavily guarded so we didn't take pictures. I don't think it is open to the public, we didn't go in.
You can see the building just by driving or walking by. It's a nice break from all the skyscrapers and quite heavily guarded.
The old parliament building is majestic and I had a great view from my room at the Galadari hotel. Reminds one of the colonial past.
This is one of the most significant buildings in Colombo. Also had a bird's eye view from my hotel room in Hilton. Very picturesque indeed

Built during the British colonial times , it is historical in many ways . Located in the heart of the city , Facing the famous Galle Face green with a sea front , it is extremely popular with the locals and foreign nationals . A five star location . Visited the Old Parliament as a kid in late 1950s . I pass by the building very often .

The Neo-Baroque-style building was built during the British colonial era to house the Legislative Council of Ceylon. It was built on an idea of Sir Henry McCallum, which led to a proposal made by a committee to construct the new building for the Secretariat, Council Chamber and Government offices on reclaimed land at the northern end of Galle Face' were accepted by the Government in 1920.. Woodson was responsible for the design of the building. The initial estimate of Rs 400,000 for the scheme was later revised by the Public Works Advisory Board to Rs 450,000, taking into account the extra expenses involved
If you are doing a sightseeing tour in cab/taxi/Colombo Tour bus, then you just have to see this building from outside while passing by as there is no stopping and parking place nearby.
Definitely the White House of Sri Lanka. Located on the galle sea face , it's huge and has an ominous presence. Not sure if used now but definitely worth few pics.

Located in a beautiful place & is such a nice building to see. Now you will see a lot of new hotels namely The Shangrila & the ITC will build up next which would attract many more tourist to our country. We must thank President Rajapaksa for developing this area rapidly.
Visited this place in our city tour itinerary, Building and the outside location was really beautiful. Worth seeing once you are in Colombo.

the location is one of the best in Colombo... on one side we have The Galadari & Hilton.... across we have the beautiful beach with all its different food stall and a place where families love to be around the waterfront .....

The Old Parliament House is a gracious building, just on the outskirts of Colombo's city centre. Apparently there are so many ministers (220 approx) that they outgrew this facility and relocated to a new Parliament House which can accommodate a larger number of people.
One of the best architecture building you would see when passing by gallface. Architecture was so nice and the location of this building.

We went from colombo station to the old lighthouse,  past the parliament building and on to galle face green. It is a very beautiful building and defenetly worth to pass by when you are in the neighbourhood. There is also a fountain in front of it.
The Building holds historical relevance. I am not sure if one can visit inside the building. we just posed for a quick picture and left the place.
You need special permit to visit inside. Though the drive through is nice, and  testimony of the hardships the Sri Lankans seemed to have endured in rebuilding the city after the LTTE Avalanche

Very picturesque Rome type building used as the Parliament of Sri Lanka some time ago. Now, been used as the presidential secretariat building. Very nice place to see. But, from outside only as you are not allowed to enter as a high security area.
This is the first Parliament in Colombo opposite of Gall face and next to Galadari Hotel. it was build during British Colonial. very good Location.
The old Parliament building which is near the Fort is a splendid building from the colonial era. There are statues of former Prime Minister's in the grounds.
The place has old and antique features with great work on structure Its a breathaking view from outside the place
Take a photo and continue your tour.  Much better architecture than the new Parliament building out of town.
Facing the sea, right in the middle of the city, a grand colonial structure. Very well maintained and easily accessible.

Situated on a very busy corner opposite Galle Face Green, Galadari hotel and the Kingsbury hotel. From the outside its a lovely old building in a brick with a couple of columns. In front a small lawned area with three statues. The iron railings are old fashioned and really complete the look. A tour inside would be good but these are not offered. A pleasant view for s few minutes to think of many years back when traffic was not so fierce.
Old parliament building is really close to Galle Face green. Worth a quick stop to take couple of photographs. Not sure if one is allowed to enter the building.
its a huge and nice building. u can spend an hour here. cool and calm. clean and maintained. the lawn around is very green
In front of beautiful Galle face Green. This is one of the best architectural monument in Sri lanka. You are not allowed to visit inside but you can see this view from roadside.

You pass this building facing the ocean near Galle Face Green. It is the old parliament building. It is closed to visitors and not particularly attractive to look at. I would not go out of my way to visit,  only if you happen to pass by.

We really liked the architect of the old parliament building, the English touch is all over the Sri Lanka, however it does clear in this building and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to visit Colombo.
Nice place to visit near by the Colombo city. The surroundings are very beautiful. Nice environment around it. Good for architecture lovers and history lovers. Worth watch.

Its worth the visit to this building situated on a main road bus stop some 500 metres away from Galle face green beach.  Entry is prohibited as some protection force is deployed at the entrance.  But building as well as the location and the surroundings are really forming the attraction.  May spent 10 minutes including for taking photos of the building and the sea on the opposite side.
Nice place near by the Colombo city. Surrounding star hotels and in front of the  the Galle face  green and very very beautiful environment.
The building is a nice monument that would be great if you can visit from inside at least for a limited part. Looking at it from outside only doesn't give it justice I guess.

Old parliament sits opposite to Galle Face Beach. It was shifted to outskirts of Colombo a few decades back. The building still looks mighty even though it has been out of use. It is one critical fragment of Colombo's history and a good picturesque location.
It is a historic architecture which was used as Srilankan parliament. Location is good facing sea. inside entry is not allowed you can just have a view or photograph while passing bye
Great British architecture -in the city of Colombo .in front of  the Indian ocean .colossal building in a great location.
I stayed at Galadari hotel which my room is facing that Historic Old Parliament Building which is now currently used by the President. The building is so beautiful.
No entry is allowed into this building however it makes for a good photography spot and is close to the sea. Not much to do so you should probably drive by this building.

We found the building very nice in pictures and at that time we did not know that we can not visit it.The garden around the building is perfectly taken care.Facing the sea there are a few statues but they are situated inside the garden at a distance that I could not read who they were. Anyway the building is imposing and I suggest to make it a starting point to visit the Fort and Pettah further North.
Even with permission you can't visit this place. just you can see from outside. The look is "Colonial"
You can't go inside anymore, atlas we couldn't. And it's besides a busy road, so you can't easily stop to take pictures. Pretty building near Galle Face Green beach, but nothing else.
Very European looking. Reminded me of Lutyens' Delhi. Doesn't look as it is used, but looked well maintained - which was very unusual in Colombo, as the whole city seems to be crumbling.

Being itself a grand "colonial building" with tall pillars all around on the sides, this building also has great counterparts (some well-preserved "beautiful" buildings from the colonial era, but others modern high-rises of the present time) nearby like The Kingsbury (must be the "greatest" hotel of Colombo just from the look of the building!) and the big white Presidential Palace; also while in the area, be sure to check out the lovely 'Old Lighthouse' just about a five-minute walk to the north from this building (I was especially delighted by the little "charming" street lined with lovely well-maintained buildings leading to the Lighthouse from the east side; being in that street was like almost "stepping back in time", and yes I'm sure there are more streets like that one in this area with "quite a few" well-preserved colonial-era buildings). You can either come up here from Galle Face Green (with the seaside promenade so "lively" with vendors' tents beside the Green) which is just about a 15-minute walk south of here, or take the bus to Colombo Fort (the city's "main station" for both trains & buses) and head west from there for about 15 to 20 minutes although that's not as straightforward a way as heading straight up north along the promenade beside Galle Face Green.

A tourist photo stop. Imposing and beautiful building. Garden is manicured to perfection. Most foreign presidents and dignitaries make this an official stop. The many government ministries within its premises make this location a hive of activity on certain days, with heightened security and traffic diversions.

Presidential Secretariat near President's House, Colombo, Built by British in 1930 and was Parliament House till 1983 from Independence.Front garden has several bronze statues of eminent statesmen... Marvelous British Era Architecture
You need to ask yourself. I can provide more if you contact me. Preserve the rights of the people, respect the legacy, history, as all speak of.

The Old Parliament  Building now houses  the Presidents Office which is known as the Presidential Secretariat, The Treasury and the Ministry of Finance . Restoration work outside the building is complete and the work continues inside . No tourist is allowed inside the building as its a high security area . But you could view from the outside and take photos. Any visitor travelling to Colombo ,Sri Lanka should not miss seeing  this historic building .
No one builds buildings like these anymore. Is it something to make a special trip for? NO you will probably pass by. Since you can just see it from outside...well....hmmmm , its imposing
Colombo,s best location, right opposite the sea. Houses the Government offices and visitors can admire it from outside only.

The old parliament building is located just in front of Galle face green. This was the parliament from 1948 to 1980 but now functions as some government office. Visitors cannot enter but can appreciate the  dutch colonial architecture
We could not go inside so decided to see it from outside .The security was strict and did not allow us to go near or take photos from close quarters. It is a grand structure.
Great location-- bang opposite the ocean at one end of the Galle face walkway. Imposing colonial edifice, off limits to tourists. Some day perhaps-‚Äì‚Äì-------
architecture of 50's looks very nice when you walk in gallface green you can see this building side has a nice lake with pelicans

Walk past this building twice in 2 days and neither times did it look like it was possible to enter. Architecturally speaking, it seems to be in a Baroque style. It does appear monumental, but not greatly so. Probably not worth making any special effort to see unless passing anyway.
A landmark building with an amazing view. If you are staying at Hotel Galadari, you will get a great view of the building. A lot of securities around.
It's indeed a good place to hang around. Clean, well maintained, in the centre of the city and definitely some historical value to it. But if you don't visit, you are surely not missing on something.

Just located at a walkable distance from the Galle Face Green is the Old Parliament Building. A colonial architecture. Did not visit inside but took a couple of pics. Worth a see, it wont take much time either

The old Parliament building is a landmark building in Colombo. It is still maintained well as a lot of Government offices are housed there. The architecture is of Colonial design & it is a beautiful  building. Even if you do not go inside a visit from out is a must, if you are interested in history & architecture. Lovely for photographs
Wooo...it ia such a nice building ..l love it......this is really a good architecture ..u have to visit this building
Driving down Colombo one cannot miss the Old parliament building as it stands in Grandeur. The architecture is more Gothic and this a marvel
old colonial building, good time pass as this place is very near to Beach, and World trade centre, and other major commercial buildings.
This place was Sri Lanka's old Parliament. After shifting to Kotte this place was now converted to Ministry of finance Building.

You are not allowed to go inside, since government offices are located inside. If you are driving by Galle Face, this building will immediately catch your eye, and makes the whole driveby really beautiful and pleasant.
With its beautiful architecture overlooking the beach it is pleasant to walk around and right within the city of Columbo the capital.

This is original parliament built by the British and it‚Äôs a fantastic in terms of architecture And historic importance ,if you are into photography then worthwhile a trip as its right in the heart of the city. The new parliament is now located in Batharamulla about 12 km from this building and quite picturesque.  The so called famous Gall face beach is right next door it used to be nice when the British looked after it now it‚Äôs just a dusty place to fly kites, of course you can go for a lovely walk when all is quite at around midnight with the sea breeze slowly caressing your face and you do feel like you are in another world. And the old parliament building is in the background and you can look across and see the Famous Gall face hotel now renovated I have not being to see it yet, once the queen stayed in this hotel when she visited Sri Lanka and so did all the movie stars of the day.
Excellent for Architecture and History Buffs. Colonial period building which housed the Parliament. Not sure how the insides are, as we were not permitted to enter.
You cannot go inside, you cannot take photographs (you'll be arrested-its a military controlled area. But the building is amazing. Wander around the outside or take a tuktuk and go slow
Now this is the presidents office ,this is one of the best land mark we have in Colombo ,its a nice colonial building .
Nice location to take photos, and a short walk away from the famous Galle Face facing the Indian Ocean. We didn't enter the building, but took lots of photos from outside.
Nice buildidng didnt get a chance to enter the building i believe the entry to this building is not allowed anymore. but yeah gud frm outside to click few phographs
If you are staying near to the beach, there are chances that you will pass this beautiful building. Do click some pictures; it's beautiful!
Don't know if you can go inside. I saw it while passing by, actually the driver drove past it specifically to show it. Not bad, but not great as well.
Nice beautiful building from the outside. But never entered it.The surroundings are pretty nice. Lots of construction work going around with a nice walk along the beach.
Looks old but still well maintained. No so many people around. No need to stop by, just pass along the way to go somewhere is enough.

The Old Parliament building stands in all its neo-baroque glory overlooking the sea at the north end of the Galle Face Green. It is worth looking at as a stately reminder of many years of Sri Lanka's vibrant history. It served as the Parliament building until a new Parliament complex was constructed in 1983. It was built in the British Colonial era and is steeped in history. A very pleasant walk, especially in the early evening, is along the Galle Face Green from the Galle Face Hotel at the southern end to the Old Parliament building at the other.

This is a giant, grand looking building and located just beginning of Gall face green(north end) .This was serving as Parliament building for 53 years and we have new Parliament building located in Jayawaradanpura which was opened in 1983. Idea for this historic building is given by sir Henry McCallum and   completed in 1930 by A.Woodson who was the chief architect
We have seen this building. Excellent consutruction done by the Britishers. Now this is open for government offices as earlier it was closed and allowed only for president.
Worth having a look at, though nothing much to offer except for "History Channel" kind of tourists who wish to know in-depth local history.
One of the landmark buidling in Colombo. Built by British about a hundred years ago. along the Galleface green. Former old parliament and now the Presidential office.
Historically significant; but not in use any more. I would have liked it if it had been turned into a museum but that's only my opinion.
You can just see the building from the nearby street. Now being used as the President's office, or somesuch.  Colonial leftover architecture. Not worth making a special trip to go there!

This British collonial periods historical old parliament building this shown for peoples very excellency,but almost we cant miss at this historical building at colombo because this situated at heart of city,here 100% British architecture design.but any cant see inside parliament gallery area,you must take a permission to see inside,but you can see around out door view, because Government cabinet meetings are held at this old parliament building.but when you will you go colombo for picnic you must go this way you had a chance for see out door side.

We could see the entire building through our window in Hilton and also when we drove by. It is a majestic looking building used during British rule and the up to the time when the new parliament was build in a picturesque location not far from Colombo.
This is a good old fashioned British architecture type building.The first independent parliament  of Ceylon held sessions here.Must see.

Old Parliament building closer to Galle Face, facing the sea front is hard to miss. It's filled with history and well worth a visit. While you are there, you can also visit some of the finer hotels near by, as well as Galle Face promenade with its famous Gall Face Hotel which was apparently used to be the former British Governor's residence. It's very much a must visit tourist site.
I  managed to take amazing photographs especially with the setting sun reflecting off the building. Very nice look architecturally

This place is closed for tourist but with right permissions you could get a glimpse of old British Architecture with some local blend . The front lawn is full of local politicians and is facing the galleface Beach (not the green) . ideal place for wedding photographs if you can get Permissions(again).
Built in British period one can drive through or halt for a while to see the traditional architectural monument in a busy street.
A good looking building. Entry to the building is not allowed. Good to stop and take a photograph with the building as background ( just like one does in front of White house at Washington DC :-)

The former Parliament was unable to be toured when I asked as it is now a government secretariat. I wondered at how well preserved it is inside and whether maintenance is kept up to date - always a challenge in tropical nations. That said, its across from the beachfront location makes it good for a quick photograph. Formally opening it to visitors would be a good initiative.
Interesting building that you can only see from the street. Not that old but interesting nevertheless. You will probably walk around there is nay case.
Stop for a while, snap a few pictures and that's just about it. Faces the beach and comes while going to fort station. As everyone has said, has some awesome colonial architecture.

Walk along Galle face green from GALLE FACE hotel along the walkway by the beach.....enjoy local people and vendors......take a photo of the old parliament.......lot of history and political skullduggery here! Walk past it UPTO the light house. Take a break. Go into the city......see the only lighthouse in the world that is in the middle of the city.....old post office...presidents house....old British era department stores.
Took a few snaps while walking down the Galle Face. Nice architecture. Definitely worth a visit while walking down Galle Face
we drove past and stopped to take photos and walk around a bit.    nice for a short stop to see historical old building, part of Colombo culture
Very quiet and amazing architecture. Old british style building, good to see. Very close to presidents house and colombo fort facing sea. Have a beautiful garden in the fromt as well
This was the old parliament bulding in Sri Lanka and now used as the Presidential Secrateriat of Sri Lanka. Nicely maintained and you will not allowed to go inside without prior approval.
Nice place facing sea with small river sort along side, a good spot for photo stop. Swans and many other birds along the river, boating goin on.... Must visit
just take a picture and move on. The design and architecture is nice.just a lot to see if you ask me.
Good looking building. It's opposite to the beach/corniche of Galle face. Everyone should visit it. Good for photography as well.
good architect , a must see site if you are an architect lover and a good walker.near by you have lovely market where you can buy some tea and china clay pots/cups.

I don't even know why this is on here as an attraction. It is a largely unused building... a small one at that that isn't even that old. There is nothing to see there too. I can however, admire the architecture and appreciate its potential to be something better.... but I can do this from my hotel room that looks directly down onto it.
we ware stroll around gall face green, this old parliament building is proudly face galle face ground. beautiful structure not to be mis in colombo
Like most people we only drove by, but looks an impressive bit of architecture. Plenty of things going on around the place, would have stopped if we had more time

We only drove by it but slowed down to look at the building and statues and it's a handsome old building which looks to have been restored/cleaned up.

Old Parliament is a jus like any other historic building. Facing the Indian ocean, there s nothing exceptional. Jus a hop from outside is Wat can be considered. If you are running out of time probably you may also skip this point.
A good view point over the ocean. Flocks of tourists buses gather there, so if you speak Chinese or japanese or Korean you might even have a free lecture joining a group ))

A beautiful building standing tall from the colonial times. It is visible from the Hilton Colombo hotel and the Galadari hotel on the Galle face side. Entry to this building is restricted and one has to enjoy the beauty of this place from a higher ground (eg. the window of the hotels next to it). You can also get a clear view from the Galle face beach front.
Although I didn't got to get inside the building but I managed to take few good shots from outside. Its really very beautiful building in front of sea shore.

the Sri Lankan parliament building is a site to visit, though one is not allowed to go near. The low rise building, typical of many other buildings in that area including the national library, stands majestically surrounded by water and a long avenue for approach from the main road. you can spend a few minutes as you drive by and take some pictures and enjoy the open lawns
To me, it's just a nice structure to look at from a distance when I walked towards the Galle Face Green.  You just took a photo or two and admired. Not much else to do ...

Old Parliament Building is one of the attractions facing the sea.The structure is fabulous,may be portugal style who had Built this. You cant go in so its an external appreciation, its centred around the Portugese Cannons so dont miss it if you are in the area. The day I was there it was heavily guarded with military vehicles as Parliament was commencing

The Old Parliament Building houses the Presidential Secretariat of Sri Lanka. The Letter of credence of incoming ambassadors and high commissioners are accepted by the President here. This Neo-Baroque-style building was built during the British colonial era to house the Legislative Council of Ceylon. It was inaugurated on January 29, 1930 by Governor Sir Herbert Stanley. It houses the island's legislature for 53 years until the New Parliament Complex was opened at Sri Jayawardenepura in 1983. The building faces the sea and is close to the Presidential house. Though not open for tourists one can see the building from the outside.

The Old Parliament Building, is the building that houses the Presidential Secretariat of Sri Lanka. Situated in the Colombo fort facing the sea, it is in close proximity to the President's House, Colombo. and American Embassy. to make you more clear it is middle of Galleface, Colombo Fort, Galadari Hotel, Galle Face Hotel. they will not Allow you to take photos out from the building due to security purposes. so I didn't have much to share with you all. when i got a good chance to view the building i will share with you. forgive me for the lack of details. All the best to visitors.

This is situated at the Gale face ,Fort it is very many five star hotels. this was the first Parliament of SriLanka (Ceylon) When the new Parliament was constructed at Battaramulla this is converted to be the Secretariat of the executive President, I have been to this place on many occasions on official visit  it is beautiful and majestic (in fact I pass this place at least twice a day)  unfortunately public or tourists are not allowed, till recent past photographing of this building or surrounding was strictly prohibited still the ban is there but not very strict. You only can see this place from outside of the guarded fence. Gale Face green is just infront you can have a long walk

This is a landmark building just in front of the Gall face and adjoining the Bare Lake. Currently use as the Presidents Secretariat .constructed by British period  . a grate tourist attraction. please refrain taking photos  as its not slowed due to security resons

It is just another building. You can stop by on your way to Galle Face and click some and move on. Nothing really special. But the building is indeed beautiful. Just that it is not a major attraction and not worth spending lot of time admiring on it.
Spectacular looking building, not allowed to take pictures as the president lived close by. The presidents helicopter would frequently land close by and streets would be closed of when ever he came.
Just had a look rom outside, and clicked some photos of the building. Nothing much to say, as we didn't have a guide to explain anything about it.
Attractive small building facing to Galle Face. You can‚Äôt get inside, prohibited to take pictures nearby this building, stylish and eye catching architecture.

Wonderful old building, with beautiful architectural.  Must be seen during the day and at night.  Recently the government has installed a beautiful lighted water feature in front of the building.  Dozens of fountains lit up in varying colours.  Well worth a quick trip.
Good place and very close to Galadari Hotel. In front of a nice Galleface beach. can study ancient Sri Lanka architecture. Clean area
Bawa's hand at work...juz could get a glimpse from the nearby road......A beautiful structure....A stand out..!!!
It is just a small version of Greek halls but its nice to watch it there. Around that is nothing but a building that you can see from your car and make no stop.

We stayed at Galadari Hotel that is just beside this building. The architectural design of this building is phenomenal. The security in front of the building does not allow taking pictures because the prime minister's residence is also there.
looked gigantic and silent. Had a feeling as if, it was trying to tell me some story...every morning I was taking a walk around this !

Not a good building. Our guide not informed us that. Any photo taking is prohibited.there is a notice about this but indistinct.as we not seen it,we took snap in my tablet.after then a security person rushed and made shout.we were very much disappointed
Typical large neoclassical building in brown stone facing the see (imitaing the greek partenon). Nothing special to see and very protected by the police.

One of my favourite locations in the Galle Face. Beautiful building build to the English style which is now used for government purposes. A beautiful view from the galle face green and amazing architecture.
Beautiful colonial building with high pillars and ceiling. Now not in use the parliament has been shifted to new premises ouside Colombo.
Under restoration during our visit, it was interesting to watch the craftsmen at work. Some very interesting carvings.

Stately and British, this structure, with a lovely green patch in front, is today referred to as the President's office as the Parliament does not function here anymore. The Galadari hotel overlooks this building, at the corner of the Galle Face Road, facing the ocean.
This majestic building in Galle face was turned into the Presidential Office after the Parliament was shifted to Sri Jayawardenapura.
It is an imposing facade that reflects grandeur, stature and class. Typical of old colonial architecture. Looks very grand when viewed at a distance. Has a panoramic view of the Indian Ocean.
